c

com.twitter.cache

ConcurrentMapCache

class ConcurrentMapCache[K, V] extends FutureCache[K, V]

A com.twitter.cache.FutureCache backed by a java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap

Any correct implementation should make sure that you evict failed results, and don't interrupt the underlying request that has been fired off. EvictingCache$ and interrupting com.twitter.util.Futures are useful tools for building correct FutureCaches. A reference implementation for caching the results of an asynchronous function with a ConcurrentMap can be found at FutureCache$.fromMap.

Linear Supertypes
FutureCache[K, V], AnyRef, Any
Known Subclasses
CaffeineCache, LoadingFutureCache, GuavaCache, LoadingFutureCache

  8.  def evict(key: K, value: Future[V]): Boolean

    Evicts the contents of a key if the old value is value.

    Evicts the contents of a key if the old value is value.

    Since com.twitter.util.Future uses reference equality, you must use the same object reference to evict a value.

    returns

    true if the key was evicted false if the key was not evicted

  10.  def get(key: K): Option[Future[V]]

    Gets the cached Future.

    Gets the cached Future.

    returns

    None if a value hasn't been specified for that key yet Some(ksync computation) if the value has been specified. Just because this returns Some(..) doesn't mean that it has been satisfied, but if it hasn't been satisfied, it's probably in-flight.
